name: Eiffel Tower, Paris
description: A wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France.

name: Statue of Liberty, New York
description: A colossal neoclassical sculpture on Liberty Island in New York Harbor.

name: Sydney Opera House
lootedMessage: The acoustics are great, but the treasure chest is singing a sad, empty song.

name: Big Ben, London
description: The nickname for the Great Bell of the striking clock at the north end of the Palace of Westminster.

name: Buckingham Palace
lootedMessage: The Queen's guards are very serious. You didn't even dare ask about the treasure.

name: Mount Fuji, Japan
description: The highest mountain in Japan, standing 3,776.24 m.

name: Angkor Wat, Cambodia
description: A temple complex in Cambodia and the largest religious monument in the world.

name: Petra, Jordan
description: A famous archaeological site in Jordan's southwestern desert, dating to around 300 B.C.

name: Borobudur Temple
lootedMessage: You climbed all 9 platforms. The only thing at the top was a great view and an empty box.

name: Great Pyramid of Giza
description: The oldest and largest of the three pyramids in the Giza pyramid complex.

name: Grand Canyon National Park
description: Layered bands of red rock revealing millions of years of geological history.

name: Yellowstone National Park
lootedMessage: A geyser erupted and launched the treasure chest into orbit. Whoops.

name: Niagara Falls
description: A group of three waterfalls at the southern end of Niagara Gorge.

name: Santorini, Greece
lootedMessage: The white and blue buildings are beautiful, but they hide no golden treasure.

name: Prague Old Town Square
description: An historic square in the Old Town quarter of Prague, the capital of the Czech Republic.

name: Brandenburg Gate, Berlin
lootedMessage: A historic gate, but the treasure has already 'marched' away.

name: Louvre Museum, Paris
description: The world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris, France.

name: Sagrada Familia, Barcelona
lootedMessage: Still under construction. Maybe they'll add the treasure later?

name: Seine River, Paris
description: An important commercial waterway within the Paris Basin in the north of France.

name: Acropolis of Athens
description: An ancient citadel located on a rocky outcrop above the city of Athens.

name: Stonehenge
lootedMessage: The mystery of Stonehenge continues: where did the treasure go?

name: Alhambra, Granada
description: A palace and fortress complex located in Granada, Andalusia, Spain.

name: Hagia Sophia, Istanbul
lootedMessage: Centuries of history, but not a single piece of gold left for you.

name: Moscow Kremlin
description: A fortified complex in the center of Moscow, overlooking the Moskva River.

name: Hermitage Museum, St. Petersburg
lootedMessage: So much art, but the only gold you see is in the picture frames.

name: Mont-Saint-Michel
description: A tidal island and mainland commune in Normandy, France.

name: Neuschwanstein Castle
lootedMessage: Looks like a fairytale castle, but your treasure story doesn't have a happy ending.

name: Loch Ness, Scotland
description: A large, deep, freshwater loch in the Scottish Highlands.

name: Table Mountain, South Africa
lootedMessage: The top is flat, and so is the inside of this treasure chest. Empty.

name: Victoria Falls
description: A waterfall on the Zambezi River in southern Africa.

name: Banff National Park
lootedMessage: A bear is using the chest as a chair. You decide not to disturb it.

name: Galapagos Islands
description: A volcanic archipelago in the Pacific Ocean, a province of Ecuador.

name: Easter Island
lootedMessage: The giant heads are watching you. They don't look impressed by your empty haul.

name: Iguazu Falls
description: Waterfalls of the Iguazu River on the border of the Argentine province of Misiones and the Brazilian state of Paran√°.

name: Pamukkale, Turkey
lootedMessage: The mineral pools are beautiful, but they dissolved all the gold.

name: Blue Lagoon, Iceland
description: A geothermal spa in southwestern Iceland.

name: Prague Castle
lootedMessage: This castle has seen a lot. Including, apparently, another pirate taking your treasure.

name: Dubrovnik Old Town
description: A historic city on the Adriatic Sea coast in the extreme south of Croatia.

name: Bruges, Belgium
lootedMessage: You found a chest full of delicious chocolates. The gold, however, is missing.

name: Fushimi Inari Shrine, Kyoto
description: The head shrine of the kami Inari, located in Fushimi-ku, Kyoto, Japan.

name: Himeji Castle
lootedMessage: A beautiful, pristine, and thoroughly looted castle.

name: Nara Park
description: A public park located in the city of Nara, Japan, at the foot of Mount Wakakusa.

name: Osaka Castle
lootedMessage: The shogun's treasure seems to be in another castle.

name: Mount Kilimanjaro
description: A dormant volcano in Tanzania. It is the highest mountain in Africa.

name: Serengeti National Park
lootedMessage: A lion is napping on the treasure chest. It looks very comfortable.

name: Masai Mara National Reserve
description: A large national game reserve in Narok, Kenya, contiguous with the Serengeti National Park.

name: Sahara Desert
lootedMessage: Sand. So much sand. The treasure is buried, and you lost your shovel.

name: Plitvice Lakes National Park
description: A 295-sq.-km forest reserve in central Croatia. It's known for a chain of 16 terraced lakes, joined by waterfalls.

name: Sistine Chapel
lootedMessage: The art is priceless, but the treasure chest is worthless. Irony.

name: Venice Grand Canal
description: A channel in Venice, Italy. It forms one of the major water-traffic corridors in the city.

name: Florence Duomo
lootedMessage: A magnificent dome with no doubloons. The treasure was used to buy paint.

name: Rome Colosseum
description: An oval amphitheatre in the centre of the city of Rome, Italy.

name: Lisbon Belem Tower
description: A 16th-century fortification located in Lisbon that served as a point of embarkation and disembarkation for Portuguese explorers.

name: Madrid Prado Museum
lootedMessage: The art is beautiful, but a painting of a treasure chest is all you found.

name: Barcelona Gothic Quarter
description: The historic center of the old city of Barcelona.

name: Oia, Santorini
lootedMessage: You watched a beautiful sunset, but it didn't magically fill the empty chest with gold.

name: Mykonos
description: An island in the Cyclades group in the Aegean Sea. It's popularly known for its summer party atmosphere.

name: Rhodes Old Town
lootedMessage: The knights who built this place were clearly better at fighting than hiding treasure.

name: Athens Parthenon
description: A former temple on the Athenian Acropolis, Greece, dedicated to the goddess Athena.

name: Times Square, New York
lootedMessage: Too many lights, too many people, and a treasure chest full of old newspapers.

name: The Shard, London
description: A 95-storey supertall skyscraper, designed by the Italian architect Renzo Piano, in Southwark, London.

name: Burj Khalifa, Dubai
lootedMessage: The view from the top is amazing! You can see for miles... but you can't see any treasure.

name: Great Barrier Reef, Australia
description: The world's largest coral reef system composed of over 2,900 individual reefs.

name: Mount Everest Base Camp
lootedMessage: It's cold. The treasure is frozen solid and you can't open the chest.

name: Forbidden City, Beijing
description: A palace complex in central Beijing, China. It houses the Palace Museum.

name: Mount Rushmore
lootedMessage: The presidents' faces are stone-cold, and so is the empty chest you found.

name: Golden Gate Bridge
description: A suspension bridge spanning the Golden Gate, the one-mile-wide strait connecting San Francisco Bay and the Pacific Ocean.

name: Christ the Redeemer, Brazil
description: An Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

name: Uluru, Australia
lootedMessage: A sacred site, and apparently, taking treasure from it is bad karma. The chest is empty.

name: Ha Long Bay, Vietnam
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, and a popular travel destination, in Qu·∫£ng Ninh Province.

name: The Great Sphinx of Giza
lootedMessage: The Sphinx knows the secret of the treasure, but it's not telling. The chest is locked and empty.

name: Amazon Rainforest
description: A moist broadleaf tropical rainforest in the Amazon biome that covers most of the Amazon basin of South America.

name: Machu Picchu, Peru
description: An Incan citadel set high in the Andes Mountains in Peru.

name: Chichen Itza, Mexico
description: A large pre-Columbian city built by the Maya people.

name: The Matterhorn, Switzerland
lootedMessage: A mountain of a challenge, but only a molehill of treasure. All gone.

name: Salar de Uyuni, Bolivia
description: The world's largest salt flat, or playa, at over 10,000 square kilometres in area.

name: Zhangjiajie National Forest Park
lootedMessage: The pillars are inspiring, but the treasure chest is just full of rocks.

name: Potala Palace, Tibet
description: A dzong fortress in the city of Lhasa, in Tibet. It was the winter palace of the Dalai Lamas from 1649 to 1959.

name: The Dead Sea
lootedMessage: You can float in the water, but your hopes of treasure will sink. It's empty.

name: The Vatican City
description: An independent city-state enclaved within Rome, Italy.

name: Mecca, Saudi Arabia
lootedMessage: A place of pilgrimage, not plunder. The treasure chest is respectfully empty.

name: Jerusalem Old City
description: A 0.9-square-kilometer walled area within the modern city of Jerusalem.

name: Hollywood Sign
lootedMessage: The treasure was used to fund a terrible movie. All that's left is a bad script.

name: Fiji Islands
description: An archipelago of more than 330 islands, famed for rugged landscapes, palm-lined beaches and coral reefs with clear lagoons.

name: Bora Bora
lootedMessage: The overwater bungalows are amazing, but they were all booked by other treasure hunters.

name: The Northern Lights, Norway
description: Natural light display in the Earth's sky, predominantly seen in high-latitude regions.

name: Angel Falls, Venezuela
lootedMessage: The waterfall is tall, but the tale of treasure was a tall tale too. Nothing.

name: Leaning Tower of Pisa
description: The campanile, or freestanding bell tower, of the cathedral of the Italian city of Pisa.

name: Mount Rushmore
description: A massive sculpture carved into Mount Rushmore in the Black Hills region of South Dakota.

name: The Louvre
description: The world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris, France.

name: Versailles Palace
lootedMessage: The Hall of Mirrors shows your reflection, holding an empty treasure chest.

name: Red Square, Moscow
description: One of the oldest and largest squares in Moscow, the capital of Russia.

name: The Great Wall of China
description: A series of fortifications that were built across the historical northern borders of ancient Chinese states.

name: Terracotta Army
lootedMessage: The clay soldiers are guarding an empty pit. You were outsmarted by an ancient emperor.

name: Las Vegas Strip
description: A stretch of South Las Vegas Boulevard in Clark County, Nevada, that is known for its concentration of resort hotels and casinos.

name: Manhattan Skyline
lootedMessage: You found a chest full of 'I ‚ô• NY' t-shirts. Not quite gold.

name: Ayers Rock (Uluru)
description: A large sandstone rock formation in the southern part of the Northern Territory in central Australia.

name: The Canadian Rockies
lootedMessage: A moose is sitting on the chest. He doesn't look like he's going to move.

name: The Panama Canal
description: An artificial 82 km waterway in Panama that connects the Atlantic Ocean with the Pacific Ocean.

name: The Galapagos Islands
description: A volcanic archipelago in the Pacific Ocean, considered one of the world's foremost destinations for wildlife-viewing.

name: Dubai's Palm Islands
lootedMessage: A luxury resort with no buried treasure. The horror!

name: St. Basil's Cathedral
description: A Christian church in Red Square in Moscow, Russia, and is one of the most popular cultural symbols of the country.

name: The fjords of Norway
description: Long, narrow, deep inlets of the sea between high cliffs, as in Norway and Iceland, typically formed by submergence of a glaciated valley.

name: The Acropolis
description: An ancient citadel located on a rocky outcrop above the city of Athens and contains the remains of several ancient buildings of great architectural and historic significance.

name: The Serengeti Migration
lootedMessage: A herd of wildebeest trampled the treasure chest into a flat, empty pancake.

name: Antarctica
description: Earth's southernmost continent. It contains the geographic South Pole and is situated in the Antarctic region of the Southern Hemisphere.

name: The Great Blue Hole, Belize
lootedMessage: You dove to the bottom and found... a single, lost flipper.

name: Victoria Peak, Hong Kong
description: A hill on the western half of Hong Kong Island. It is also known as Mount Austin, and locally as The Peak.

name: The Cliffs of Moher, Ireland
lootedMessage: The leprechaun at the end of the rainbow already took this pot of gold.

name: The French Riviera
description: The Mediterranean coast of southeastern France. It includes famously glamorous beach resorts such as Saint-Tropez and Cannes.

name: The Black Forest, Germany
lootedMessage: You found a chest full of delicious cake, but no coins.

name: The Grand Palace, Bangkok
description: A complex of buildings at the heart of Bangkok, Thailand. The palace has been the official residence of the Kings of Siam since 1782.

name: The Swiss Alps
lootedMessage: A chest full of Swiss cheese. It's holy, but not in a valuable way.

name: Tokyo Shibuya Crossing
description: A popular scramble crossing in Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan. It is one of the busiest intersections in the world.

name: The DMZ, Korea
lootedMessage: This place is heavily guarded. You decide your health is the real treasure.

name: The Canals of Amsterdam
description: The city‚Äôs concentric canals, built in the 17th century, are a marvel of city planning and architecture.

name: The Sahara Dunes
description: The largest hot desert in the world. The desert comprises much of North Africa.

name: The Nile River Cruise
lootedMessage: A crocodile snatched the chest right out of your hands. Maybe next time.

name: The Blue Mosque, Istanbul
description: An Ottoman-era historical imperial mosque located in Istanbul, Turkey.

name: The Rock of Gibraltar
lootedMessage: The monkeys here are notorious thieves. Your chest is empty.

name: The Scottish Highlands
description: A historic region of Scotland. The region became culturally distinguishable from the Lowlands from the later Middle Ages.

name: The Sydney Harbour Bridge
lootedMessage: You climbed to the top, but the treasure had already been 'bridged'.

name: The Great Ocean Road, Australia
description: An Australian National Heritage listed 243-kilometre stretch of road along the south-eastern coast of Australia between the Victorian cities of Torquay and Allansford.

name: The temples of Bagan, Myanmar
lootedMessage: Over 2,000 temples, and not a single one had your treasure. Unlucky.

name: The Dead Vlei, Namibia
description: A white clay pan located near the more famous salt pan of Sossusvlei, inside the Namib-Naukluft Park in Namibia.

name: The Danube River
lootedMessage: The beautiful blue Danube is not the beautiful gold Danube. Chest is empty.

name: The Giant's Causeway
description: An area of about 40,000 interlocking basalt columns, the result of an ancient volcanic fissure eruption.

name: The Atacama Desert
lootedMessage: The driest place on Earth. So dry, even the treasure has evaporated.

name: The Wailing Wall, Jerusalem
description: An ancient limestone wall in the Old City of Jerusalem. It is a relatively small segment of a far longer ancient retaining wall.

name: The peak of Mount Cook
lootedMessage: You planted a flag, but found no treasure. Just a lot of snow.

name: The canals of St. Petersburg
description: A network of canals and channels, which has earned the city the nickname 'Venice of the North'.

name: The geysers of Iceland
lootedMessage: The treasure was in the geyser. It's now in low-earth orbit.
